column4: its not a regular disk. its a ptp device you can fuse mount it
or mtp rather
its obnoxious. a little additional circuitry and they could enable gadget mode in the kernel and export usb mass storage from an ext3 filesystem
right .... I have an LG android phone that lets me mount both the system disk and the sd card
do you happen to know if the nexus 7 has the same problem?
its one of the main reasons im not upgrading to ICS
if you assume that there isn't any point in securing anything
sure there is ... the goal is to make your system harder to crack than average, so that they spend time elsewhere :)
which contradicts your assumption. if they have infinite resources they attack all computers at the same time
you can choose to go reductio ad absurdum if you want, that doesn't make my point any less valid

the style of the statement is in the style of the statements that are common in the cryptography community. but its a ridiculous thing to say in that community (assume the attacker can perform X flops, or that the attacker can factor primes in X time etc). you clearly mean it in some other sense... not sure what sense that is or what you want it to mean.
jockey is not present in yokobr's release. it was removed in 12.10 and up
I have 12.10 :)
but its not part of the standard install. i think you get it if you had it earlier, but they are moving away from it
well this was a clean install
https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/quantal/i386/jockey-gtk
I already have it, but thanks :)
i'm saying look at that link. also run "dpkg -L jockey-gtk" you will see no binary in the output. there is no jockey-gtk for a 12.10 user to run
got it :)
canonical does a terrible job of announcing these kinds of changes... it kinda drives me crazy
right
